cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, forecast to accelerate north-northeast across the eastern Gulf toward the Florida Big Bend, then sweep northeast across southeast Georgia and the Carolinas and exit into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (Indian Pass–Aucilla River area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL northward to South Santee River SC (includes the entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for Georgia coast (current warnings confined to Florida Gulf coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, southeast Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely Wednesday; brief stronger gusts possible if core tracks just inland.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along the Georgia coast, including St. Simons Sound and the Brunswick river entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash and urban flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Wednesday; dangerous surf and rip currents ahead of the storm.
